title: What are Large Language Models?
content:
AI models trained on massive text datasets.
Predict the next word in a sequence.
Perform various natural language tasks.
image_desc:
A diagram showing a large language model processing text input and generating text output, with arrows indicating the flow of information. Type: diagram

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: Large language models or LLMs are AI systems like GPT4 They're trained on massive amounts of text learning to predict the next word in a sentencelike solving a giant word puzzle This allows them to perform tasks such as classification summarization translation and content generation

title: Prompt Engineering: Getting the Best Results
content:
Be specific in your prompts.
Use the right model for the task.
Specify desired point of view.
Guide the desired length of the output.
Use "new topic" buttons when changing subjects.
image_desc:
An image depicting a person interacting with a computer, crafting a detailed and specific prompt. Type: photo

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: Getting the most out of LLMs involves effective prompt engineering  This means crafting clear specific prompts to guide the model towards the desired output  Consider the model's strengths specify your desired length and perspective and use tools like new topic buttons for topic changes

title: Copilot: An LLM-Powered Research Assistant
content: (Caption below the image) Copilot assists with research, planning, and creative tasks.
image_desc:
A screenshot of the Microsoft Copilot interface showing a user interacting with the system. Type: screenshot

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: Microsoft's Copilot is a great example of an LLMpowered tool It acts as a research assistant personal planner and creative partner helping users ask complex questions get summarized answers and even generate creative content

title: Important Considerations: Fact-Checking & Limitations
content:
Always fact-check LLM outputs.
LLMs can be inaccurate or incomplete.
LLMs don't understand or evaluate accuracy.
Copilot provides sources for evaluation.
image_desc:
An image representing the importance of critical thinking and fact-checking, perhaps a person verifying information from multiple sources. Type: illustration

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: While impressive LLMs aren't perfect  Always factcheck their outputs as they can be inaccurate or incomplete  Remember LLMs don't inherently understand or evaluate the accuracy of their responses  Tools like Copilot help by providing sources for verification

title: LLM Use Case: Syllabus Creation
content:
Faculty member uses Copilot to create a syllabus.
Iterative prompting refines the output.
Quickly generates learning objectives.
Saves time and improves efficiency.
